qas.question: What part of Universal's business was terminated while it was in bankruptcy?
Along with distribution and studio operations, what part of Universal was retained by Carl Laemmle, Jr. during bankruptcy?
What type of chain conglomerate was scrapped?
What did Carl Jr hold fast in addition to the theater chain?
What period did Universal move into high-quality production in?

context: Universal's forays into high-quality production spelled the end of the Laemmle era at the studio. Taking on the task of modernizing and upgrading a film conglomerate in the depths of <b4_0>the depression<b4_0/> was risky, and for a time Universal slipped into receivership. <a0_0>The <b2_0>theater<b2_0/> chain<a0_0/> was scrapped, but Carl, Jr. held fast to <b3_0>distribution, studio and <a1_0>production operations<b3_0/><a1_0/>.
